blog.name: acepalindrome
blog.title: you're going to be something extraordinary
blog.description: Hello, this is Palindrome! I'm currently doing my best to pretend that I'm a functional and well adjusted adult, with varying levels of success! Around this neck of the woods you'll find history stuff, nature stuff, whatever fandoms I'm into at the moment, fanfics I write when I can muster up the energy, the occasional mental breakdown and a variety of fun facts I come across or things I find interesting. Feel free to follow or drop me a line, I promise I'm quite tame.

tags: im so fucked up about them
summary: I’m having feelings about Fjord growing up alone and not having anyone to look after him or protect him, and living his whole...
body: I’m having feelings about Fjord growing up alone and not having anyone to look after him or protect him, and living his whole life hiding behind difference masks to protect himself…and then Jester crashes into his life and gets him to let down his walls a little, let’s him feel okay to let her know the real Fjord. And this wonderful, tough, funny, beautiful girl wants to protect him! She talks multiple times about wanting to keep him safe and healing him when he’s hurt, and think about what that means for Fjord who never had anyone protect him or treat him so gently before. She’s seen some of his real self, who he hates, and she thinks he’s worth her care and protection.

She’s seen some of his real self, who he hates, and she thinks he’s worth her care and protection.

And this wonderful, tough, funny, beautiful girl wants to protect him! She talks multiple times about wanting to keep him safe and healing him when he’s hurt, and think about what that means for Fjord who never had anyone protect him or treat him so gently before. She’s seen some of his real self, who he hates, and she thinks he’s worth her care and protection.

summary: so they’re in the middle of a fresh battlefield scattered with the remains of eldritch horrors from another plane, in the middle...
body:
so they’re in the middle of a fresh battlefield scattered with the remains of eldritch horrors from another plane, in the middle of a dark almost moonless night, surrounded by dead hollow trees, sitting by a faint glow of a meager fire, the only splash of warmth to stave off the biting cold of the devastated plains.

and they’re about to pull out a mildly stale severed head of a hobgoblin to talk to it.

that would’ve been quite a Romantic painting if not for Caleb squishing shit out of the bats off to the side like a toothpaste.

summary: Last night was the first show I've been able to watch live since I caught up, and I'm so glad I did. The creepy handsy things,...
question: Last night was the first show I've been able to watch live since I caught up, and I'm so glad I did. The creepy handsy things, Beau giving Yasha that Gay Look(tm), Fjord calling Jester "Jessie", and THE CHEEK KISS. I honestly was barely paying attention to the combat but as soon as I heard that I was all in. Plus the two of them killing the monster then the bats was cute too.
answer:
What a good first live episode to watch!!!!

And same! I was distracted for a good 30 minutes after that cheek kiss, because I was just SO SHOOK! I know that other things happened, but I missed so much. I will definitely be rewatching the episode at some point this weekend.

reblog.comment:
What a good first live episode to watch!!!!

And same! I was distracted for a good 30 minutes after that cheek kiss, because I was just SO SHOOK! I know that other things happened, but I missed so much. I will definitely be rewatching the episode at some point this weekend.

tags: i smell a jester arc in our future
summary: Theory: How Astrid and Eodwulf will Make Their First Apearance
body:
Theory: How Astrid and Eodwulf will Make Their First Apearance

Ok so this is all I could think about during class today so here’s a very rambling theory on how I think the Nein will first meet Astrid and Eodwulf.

First off why? Well first of all we know that Astrid and Eodwulf are shadows, they don’t exist. They also killed their family and now are getting a letter saying that a family member is alive so that’s red flag one. Red flag two, Astrid was called BY NAME. So from her POV a random person not only claims she has living family but also knows her name. It’s safe to say they know some tom foolery is going on. So they trace the name. Lavorre.

So Astrid. She’ll obvi go after Marion since I doubt she would have much trouble finding the Ruby’s real name. She’ll most likely disguise herself as someone from the Chateau and kidnap Marion to get her out of the way in order to trick Jester and get close to her after most likely interrogating Marion. Astrid gets Jetser to the Chateu and disguised as Marion gets alone with her.

Ok now Eodwulf, At first I was stuck on him but then it hit me. He’s big. Now who else is close to Jester in the Chateu that is also big? Blude the Minotaur guard. Jester would be in no way sus about being alone with the two of them.

I can’t say for sure what would happen after this point, I like to think Jetser will figure them out (I think she would) but who’s to say. They could even reveal themselves when an undisguised Caleb enters the Chateau

summary: It occurs to me that the Mighty Nein still have Fjord’s Soltryce Academy recommendation letter. Obviously he’s not going to go...
body: It occurs to me that the Mighty Nein still have Fjord’s Soltryce Academy recommendation letter. Obviously he’s not going to go there anymore, for…just, so many reasons at this point. But I feel like the letter could still be potentially useful when they inevitably go back to the Empire and go to Rexxentrum. What I mean of course is that I want them to use the letter for an infiltration mission to the Academy! Why are they infiltrating in this scenario? What are they hoping to gain from this? I don’t know! But I want it!!!

blog.name: luckthebard
blog.title: Luck the Bard
blog.description: 30s, Queer (Lesbian), I love D&D; My brother got me hooked on Critical Role. I try but don't always tag spoilers so this account is not #spoilerfree

summary: If anyone is a budding DM and wants an example of how to adjust the balance of a D&D fight on-the-fly, I think campaign 2...
body:
If anyone is a budding DM and wants an example of how to adjust the balance of a D&D fight on-the-fly, I think campaign 2 episode 64 of Critical Role is a good one to take a look at.

The party rolled really well and used some great tactics (Stunning Strike, casting Daylight to weaken the monsters’ special ability) right at the top of the fight. And while it’s nice as players to feel like you’re doing well, battles always feel more satisfying if the victory is at least a little hard won, and not a total sweep.

Matt had the monsters enter in waves, including adding one toward what felt like the end of the fight in a tense moment where one character was in dire straights. This made everyone more alert, drew the players back into the game, and made the victory all the more satisfying. 

The smart thing about having waves of creatures to potentially enter combat in a circumstance like this is, if the party had rolled very poorly right out of the gate and been struggling against the initial wave of creatures, Matt as the DM could have chosen to not have the potential last wave enter combat. 

I don’t want it to sound negative when I say this is one of the more transparent cases of him using this tactic. On the contrary, I think the straightforward use of the technique makes the episode a great DM teaching tool.

reblog.comment:
If anyone is a budding DM and wants an example of how to adjust the balance of a D&D fight on-the-fly, I think campaign 2 episode 64 of Critical Role is a good one to take a look at.

The party rolled really well and used some great tactics (Stunning Strike, casting Daylight to weaken the monsters’ special ability) right at the top of the fight. And while it’s nice as players to feel like you’re doing well, battles always feel more satisfying if the victory is at least a little hard won, and not a total sweep.

I don’t want it to sound negative when I say this is one of the more transparent cases of him using this tactic. On the contrary, I think the straightforward use of the technique makes the episode a great DM teaching tool.

If anyone is a budding DM and wants an example of how to adjust the balance of a D&D fight on-the-fly, I think campaign 2 episode 64 of Critical Role is a good one to take a look at.

blog.name: hazelcephalopod
blog.title: Another Side of the Mirror
blog.description:
This has mostly turned into a CR blog-thing... I tag Thursday show until around Tuesday.

Hello peoples of Tumblr! This is my blog, which I make no promise to keep up with. I'm a bisexual Autistic. Also have ADD. I like cephalopods, especially cuttlefish, and plants, and reading, and many other geeky things.

More random tidbit: feminist, somewhere in the left politically, and tired of the political landscape but still trying to care. Also a lapsed pagan, it sounds like nonsense but idk how else to describe it. More things- gluten free, and crochet, knitting, and others. Beware of my many random posts as well.

That is all for now!

Oh BTW I am bad at tagging things, trying to get better, but its a work in progress.

summary: CR, Sending to Marion/Ruby of the Sea
title: CR, Sending to Marion/Ruby of the Sea
body:
Jester: Hi… little worried, someone may be coming to Chateau. If you see a girl, five three {5′3″}, brown hair and eyes. Short hair. Scars on her arms. 

Marion: Jester, [my Jester]. I’m worried from the tone of your voice. I’ll keep a look out. I miss you, come back soon.

Everything is brackets wasn’t quite clear to my so I filled in best I could. Jester and her mom talk fast.

blog.name: moonaskingtostay
blog.description: Morgane. French. Fan of Stuff.

summary: Hi! I've been wanting to start watching critical role, but I literally know NOTHING about DnD. I started watching a few of the...
question: Hi! I've been wanting to start watching critical role, but I literally know NOTHING about DnD. I started watching a few of the handbooker helper videos they made, but I wanted to know if you had any suggestions as to how to start...
answer: Yeah, you’re fine, I didn’t know anything about d&d when I started watching critical role. The handbooker videos are cool if you want to know the basics, but you can just jump in, everything that happens is pretty much self explanatory.

reblog.comment: Yeah, you’re fine, I didn’t know anything about d&d when I started watching critical role. The handbooker videos are cool if you want to know the basics, but you can just jump in, everything that happens is pretty much self explanatory.
